title: Pink Floyd What If? [FLAC]
description:
FLAC 24 bit 8pcm Version

Pink Floyd What If? Project.

Created by OfAnthony

What if Roger stayed? That's the concept behind the Pink Floyd What If? Project. These two "imagined" albums were made to represent what Floyd could have sounded like if the band stayed together. Note that these albums are not presented in the style of a compilation, but more along the lines of the classic Pink Floyd style concept album. The types of albums missed when Roger left Pink Floyd. The music is arranged according to similar lyrical themes and musical compositions, using the last two Pink Floyd albums, A Momentary Lapse Of Reason (1987) and The Division Bell (1994) with the solo work of Roger Water's The Pros and Cons of Hitchhiking (1985), When The Wind Blows Soundtrack (1986) Radio K.A.O.S (1987) and Amused To Death (1992) . Also used are two tracks from David Gilmour's second solo album About Face (1984); Here's a brief description of what each Album consists of.

IRREVERSIBLE (Imagined) (1986)

Irreversible contains music from Pink Floyd's A Momentary Lapse of Reason (1987) with Roger Waters' Radio K.A.O.S (1987), The Pros and Cons of Hitch Hiking (1985) (two tracks from the Radio K.A.O.S demos), and also two tracks from Gilmour's solo album About Face (1984). (Also used is one track from The 6th disc of The Wall Immersion boxed set.) (Imagined as a follow up to The Final Cut (1983).

IRREVERSIBLE Track Listing:

01 Going To Live In L.A
02 A New Machine, Pt.1
03 Yet Another Movie
04 The Powers That Be
05 Murder
06 One Slip
07 Dunroamin, Duncarin, Dunlivin
08 A New Machine, Pt.2
09 Learning To Fly
10 Who Needs Information?
11 Sorrow
---------------------
12 Me Or Him
13 Running Shoes
14 Arabs with Knives and West German Skies
15 It's Never Too Late
16 On The Turning Away
17 Sexual Revolution
18 Near The End
19 The Tide Is Turning
20 Get Back To Radio
21 The Moment Of Clarity


PERFECT SENSE (Imagined) (1992)

Perfect Sense, the second album included; and takes tracks from Pink Floyd's The Division Bell (1994), with Waters' solo album Amused to Death (1992), and selections from the soundtrack for When The Wind Blows (1986). (Imagined as the last Pink Floyd album released, after...Irreversible)

----------------------

All tracks were ripped in FLAC @ 32Bit 8pcm and mixed to FLAC 24bit 8pcm using Audacity. Please seed and share, and comment. I'd like to know what people think. Also let's try and continue to spread the word that we would like to see Roger, Nick and Dave collaborate once again. *****AS OF JULY 5th 2014 PINK FLOYD HAS ANNOUNCED THEY WILL BE RELEASING A NEW ALBUM IN OCTOBER!***** Without Roger of course. Oh well! However it is nice to see that the late Richard Wright will be featured on the new album, using works recorded supposedly from The Division Bell sessions, along with David Gilmour and Nick Mason. If they would only...
